name: Match the Movie Quiz | Name the Movie | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of these 80's blockbusters featured the charismatic Mr. Harrison Ford?
questions.explanation:
All of them.

	Yep, Harrison Ford was a busy man in the 1980s.  Not only was he featured in the two 'Star Wars' sequels, 'The Empire Strikes Back' (1980) and 'The Return of the Jedi' (1983), he also made three 'Indiana Jones' films, including the original 'Raiders of the Lost Ark' (1981).  Ford took time out to make some quiet thrillers as well, including 1985's 'Witness'.

questions.text: Johnny Depp has been a busy man during his several decade career, but among these four 2004 movies, which is the only one in which he appeared?
questions.explanation:
Finding Neverland.

	Johnny Depp played Sir James Barrie, author of 'Peter Pan', in the 2004 movie 'Finding Neverland'.  The film tells the story about the development of said play, and his relationship with the Llewelyn-Davies family, who were the inspiration for his greatest work.

questions.text: Uma Thurman certainly doesn't have difficulty finding work.  Which of these films from the 1990s featured the lovely and talented Uma?
questions.explanation:
Pulp Fiction.

	Uma Thurman played Mia Wallace, wife of Marsellus Wallace, in Quentin Tarantino's 1994 masterpiece 'Pulp Fiction'.  Mia is just one of several integral characters in that film, which weaves in and out of the lives of various gangsters, drug pushers and other ne'er-do-wells.  Uma also appeared in Tarantino's 'Kill Bill' films.

questions.text: Which of these comedy films of the 1980s featured the capable and talented actress Whoopi Goldberg?
questions.explanation:
Jumpin' Jack Flash.

	Directed by Penny Marshall, 'Jumpin' Jack Flash' tells the story of Terry Doolittle, a bank worker who becomes firmly ensconced in a full-blown spy caper when she meets a mysterious secret operative through the bank's computer network.  Goldberg is charming in this film.

questions.text: Now a little bit more challenging.  Which of these was an early film of actress extraordinaire Meryl Streep?
questions.explanation:
Julia.

	As a matter of fact, 'Julia' marked the screen debut of Ms Streep.  The story revolves around Lillian Hellman, a real life writer (and author of the novel upon which the film is based) who is attempting to secret money to a childhood friend in Nazi Germany.  Jane Fonda and Vanessa Redgrave play the lead roles in this film.

questions.text: Michael Caine, who has entertained movie audiences for decades, only appears in one of these 1960's films, but which?
questions.explanation:
Zulu.

	Michael Caine plays a British officer in the 1964 war film 'Zulu'.  The film depicts the events surrounding a particularly brutal battle during the Zulu wars of the late 19th century.  It's one of Caine's first major roles.

questions.text: Let's go Hollywood old school, shall we?  Which of these movies had the fortune of featuring four-time Oscar-winner Katharine Hepburn?
questions.explanation:
Adam's Rib.

	'Adam's Rib', the story of an otherwise loving husband and wife who duel in a courtroom over a bitter divorce case.  This 1950 film is often cited as the best of the seven films featuring the screen team of Hepburn and Spencer Tracy.

questions.text: James Cagney certainly got around in his time, but he only appeared in one of these all-time screen classics.  Which?
questions.explanation:
White Heat.

	'White Heat' once again combined the superb acting of Mr. Cagney with the able direction of Raoul Walsh.  In the film, Cagney plays a gangster who unwittingly befriends an undercover cop, played by my personal favorite actor Edmond O'Brien.  Cagney hopes to pull off one last big burglary before retiring from the crime business, while O'Brien hopes to foil the burglary attempt.

questions.text: Now a couple of character actors.  Before Philip Seymour Hoffman made it big in 2005 with his Oscar-winning performance in 'Capote', he was featured in a supporting role in which of these films?
questions.explanation:
Magnolia.

	Philip Seymour Hoffman made a career out of character acting, appearing in a vast array of films including 'Scent of a Woman', 'Boogie Nights' and 'The Big Lebowski' before taking on a number of lead roles in the 2000s.  In 'Magnolia', Hoffman plays a nurse to the dying Jason Robards character.  The movie weaves in and out of the lives of these two characters, along with several others, in an almost random milieu, with bizarre events occurring on a regular basis.  Hard to explain, but a lot of fun to watch.

questions.text: Frances McDormand is another acting professional who has made a career of playing character roles, but who has broken through with a Best Actress Oscar, was featured in only one of the following movies.  Select that movie.
questions.explanation:
Almost Famous.

	Though McDormand is a Best Actress winner (for her efforts in the 1996 film 'Fargo'), she is best known for playing smaller character roles.  Take for example her role in 'Almost Famous' where she plays the skeptical mother of the Patrick Fugit character, a young man who hopes to achieve success as a rock-n-roll writer for 'Rolling Stone'.  McDormand nearly steals the show despite her relatively small role. I hope you have enjoyed this quiz.  Let me know if you want more.
